author: lightclient
content:
anyone else implement t11s? https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/tree/master/cmd/evm#transaction-tool

I think to verify bounds of the 7702 txs clients will need to implement the t11s tool. It's a "transaction" checker which takes an RLP list of txs and verifies encoding / decoding integrity. e.g. to ensure that clients will reject transactions with a chain ID > 2^64, we would encode such a special tx RLP and try to decode with t11s

author: _shemnon
content: Besu only has t8n and b11r.  The reasons for those are they are what the EEST loop uses.  Having EEST use t9s is the best way to encourage adoption, and is similar to the EOF validation checks.
